lines.text: This is an outrage! You are a disgrace to your Phylum, Order, Class, Genus and Spe...
Say it in English!
YOU, sir, are an ASS!
[James has discovered he has changed]
Marvelous things will happen.
Did he say, "Marvelous pigs in satin"?
No, dear lady.
[He takes out a megaphone and speaks through it]
Marvelous things will happen.
[to James]
Poor Glowworm, she's a little deaf.
I, on the other hand, have exquisite hearing.
Oh, yeah? Well, listen to this...
[He spits into his many hands and grabs the megaphone and yells into it]
LET'S GET OUTTA HERE!
I've sailed all the five seas. From the land of Bora Bora to the icy shores of Tripoli. Commodore Centipede, they used to call me.
Seven.
Huh?
There are seven seas, and Tripoli is in the Sub-Tropics, Commodore!
Trim the sails!
There are no sails.
Start the engines!
There are no engines.
I can't work with this miserable crew!
What are they?
Crocodile tongues.
Tongues?

Long, slimy crocodile tongues boiled in the skull of a dead witch for 40 days and 40 nights. And, the gizard of a pig, the fingers of a young monkey, the beak of a parrot and three spoonfuls of sugar, and then, let the moon do the rest.
[Spiker and Sponge are outside the peach, looking for James]
Where are you? You little worm!
AAAHHHHHH!
Not you, ME!
Whenever I had a problem, my parents told me to look at it another way.
*How*? First, I was bird bait, and then I was *shark* bait.
That's true, but you could say that you gave us wings to fly, and that you defeated a giant shark single-handedly.
No-handedly.
You're a hero.
I am. I'm Wonderworm!

I look and smell, I do declare, as lovely as a rose. Just feast your eyes upon my face, observe my shapely nose. Behold my heavenly silky locks, and if I take off both my socks, you'll see my dainty toes.
But don't forget, my dearest Sponge, how much your tummy shows!
Remember what your parents said, James... Try looking at it another way!
[in the darkness]

[Centipede pinches him]
Ow! What was that?
Sorry, I thought you were the spider.

[Miss Spider hits him]
Ouch. What was *that*?
Excuse, I thought you were the Centipede.
Oh this is all my fault.
Hey don't take all the credit, I helped too!
[the compass is lost during a storm]
We'll be blown off course!
We'll wind up in Jersey!
[the Beat Cop has been asked what the large fruit is]
I don't know. Just get the biggest crane in New York!
[everyone is discussing how to get the peach to New York]
We could... No, it's stupid.
Compared to what?
Well, I suppose we could fly out.
He's right. It's stupid.

[eating the peach]
Mmmmm. Better than ladybugs.
What?
Excuse me.
It's not dirt...
[takes a bite of the peach]
But it's not bad.
Why don't skeletons play music in church? Because they got no organs.
The sun's so hot! I'm roasted!
She won't be coming down here with the spray. She'll be coming down here with a shovel. It happened to m' brother. Split him right down the middle. Now I have two half-brothers.
Excuse me, sir, can you tell me where the Empire State Building is?
You're on top of it, kid.
Time to go make a pest of myself!
Let the biddies come! I'll take 'em both on! I'm undefeatable. I'm indivisible. I'm...
[James falls on him]
... in trouble!
We gotta get out of here. We'll be turned into living statues.
*Dead* living statues!
Centipede I do not know whether to kill you or kiss you.

I crave the tasty tentacles of octopi for tea/I like hot dogs, but I love hot frogs, and surely you'll agree/A plate of soil with engine oil is a super recipe. I hardy need to mention that it's practically free!
Hey, Glowworm, how 'bout some light?
I can't hear you. I'll have to put my light on.
We're not lost.
Then where are we?
Somewhere up north. Or, possibly, very far south.
What's your latitude? What's your longitude?
Hey, hey, hey! That's personal, bud!
Great! We'll be stuck here until we starve and die.
Highly improbable.
Well, that's encouraging.
We are far more likely to drown.
No-one is going to squoosh you, old boy. You're six feet long now.
Bigger targets.
You're not even a real rhino! You're just a lot of smoke and noise! I'm not afraid of you!
We'll always be together, right?
Kid, you're stuck with us, for life.
[on his experience of the world]
I did live between two pages of The National Geographic. Very informative magazine, the National Geographic. Lots of nice pictures.
I can't remember what fun is for.
[the bugs and James have landed in the ocean]
We are in, what you call, the Big Puddle.
We sent you out here to kill a spider!
Not to laze about.
I wasn't lazing about, I tripped.
How dare you disagree with us!
We are in the middle of the, how do you say, the big puddle.
Biggest puddle of 'em all, angel fangs - the Atlantic Ocean.
Technically, the Pacific is the biggest.
Well, that goes without saying.
Biggest puddle of them all, Angel Fangs. The Atlantic Ocean.
Tecnically, the Pacific is larger.
Well... that goes without saying.
God bless the colonies!
[Gazing at the giant peach]
It smells delicious!
No! It smells like money.
Try looking at it another way.

[singing]
For dinner on my birthday, shall I tell you what I chose? Hot noodles made from poodles on a slice of garden hose/And a rather smelly jelly made from armadillo's toes/The jelly is delicious, but you have to hold your nose!
I'm crazy about mosquitoes on a piece of buttered toast/And pickled spines of porcupines and a great big roast!/And dragon's flesh, quite old, not fresh, it costs a buck at most!
Does it come with gravy?
It comes to you in barrels if you order it by post!
No one will be eating you James.
Naw, she'll just puncture your head and suck out the brains.
That I am saving for you.

[to metal shark]
Teach you to mess with me, you overgrown sardine! I'm from Brooklyn!
[the centipede is being stretched out by the pirates; one approaches with an axe]
It's Paul Bunyan. He's come to cut me some slack. Hey, aiming a little low, aren't you, buddy? He's going to cut me in half!
He's committed pesticide!
Can I touch it?
Touch it? You can't touch it.
She'll be wanting to taste it next.

[Tears up ticket]
Admission denied. This child has too many cheeky ideas.
Holy shipwreck!

[Swatting a butterfly]
Ew, wouldn't want one of those nesting in your knickers.
Nice aim, Commodore.

[to each other, after their fighting knocks the last of the food overboard]
NOW look what you've done!
